item.title: Slowloris Attack #whitehat
item.description: Denial-of-Service (DoS) attacks are a critical threat to web server security. One particularly insidious type is the Slowloris attack, which can incapacitate a server with minimal resources. Remember, this guide is for educational purposes only, and any unauthorized testing on live servers is illegal and unethical. What is a Slow Loris Attack? A Slow Loris attack involves sending numerous incomplete HTTP requests to a target server. By maintaining these connections open with periodic headers but never completing them, the server’s resources are tied up, preventing legitimate users from accessing the server.
